hypothesis_content.title: Neutral Regime ETH/BTC Strength as Bull Regime Precursor
hypothesis_content.statement: During extended NEUTRAL regimes (>10 days), if the ETH/BTC ratio (ETH priced in BTC) breaks above its 20-day moving average on a weekly closing basis (Friday UTC 23:59), it signals an impending transition to a BULL regime. A long position in ETH will outperform a long position in BTC over the following 10 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: ETH/BTC strength is a classic indicator of 'altseason' and broad risk appetite. In a prolonged Neutral state, a sustained break in this key ratio suggests smart money is positioning for a broader market advance, with capital flowing into the largest altcoin/ smart contract platform ahead of the move. It often leads the regime shift.
entry_conditions: Weekly candle close (Friday) where ETH/BTC ratio > its 20-day SMA
Enter long ETH at Monday's open following the signal

exit_conditions.time_exit: Regime transitions to BULL or BEAR before 10 days.

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Following the signal, the probability of transitioning to a BULL regime within 15 days is not statistically significantly higher than the baseline transition probability from Neutral. Additionally, ETH fails to outperform BTC over the 10-day window.
